item.title: è®ºæ–‡åˆ†äº«ã€mnsc.2018.3212ã€‘
item.description: ğŸ“˜ Abstract: The paper compared the Line-sitting, FIFO, Priority scheme in a queuing system. The comparison is accomplished in terms of customer welfare and service providerâ€™s revenue. The main method is modeling. It turns out that only Line-sitting scheme is able to achieve a win-win-win situation between customer, service provider and line-sitting firm.
item.content:encoded:
ğŸ“˜ Abstract: The paper compared the Line-sitting, FIFO, Priority scheme in a queuing system. The comparison is accomplished in terms of customer welfare and service providerâ€™s revenue. The main method is modeling. It turns out that only Line-sitting scheme is able to achieve a win-win-win situation between customer, service provider and line-sitting firm.

1 Introduction



2 Model






3 FIFO vs Line-sitting


4 Priority






5 Extensions

[1] Shiliang Cui, Zhongbin Wang, Luyi Yang (2019) The Economics of Line-Sitting. Management Science 66(1):227-242.

item.title: è®ºæ–‡åˆ†äº«ã€mnsc.2019.3401ã€‘
item.description: ğŸ“˜ Abstract: Increasing salary by 20% would decrease the voluntary attrition by 5%, whereas changing agentsâ€™ supervisors to the best supervisor would decrease the voluntary attrition by 10%. The greatest contribution of the paper is the comparison between raising salary and changing supervisors.
item.content:encoded:
ğŸ“˜ Abstract: Increasing salary by 20% would decrease the voluntary attrition by 5%, whereas changing agentsâ€™ supervisors to the best supervisor would decrease the voluntary attrition by 10%. The greatest contribution of the paper is the comparison between raising salary and changing supervisors.
